alert.note: Alert for Boyd; Holt; Keya Paha; Rock (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 18 at 2:18PM CST until January 19 at 12:00PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM FRIDAY TO NOON CST SATURDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph. For the Wind Chill Advisories, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. * WHERE...Keya Paha, Boyd, Rock and Holt Counties. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 AM CST Friday. For the first Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Friday. For the second Wind Chill Advisory, from 6 PM Friday to noon CST Saturday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Strong wind gusts today may lead to areas of blowing snow from existing snow pack in addition to new snowfall.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information.
